description: Ms. codex. Title from fol. 2a. 26 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with occasional use of red for rubrication. Ms. written in several different hands and some parts are of a later date than the rest. Thick dark cream glazed paper with visible laid lines and prominent fibres. Foliation in Western numerals in pencil. Fol. 4a has an inscription about the Fuṣūs al-Ḥikam signed by al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad al-Būrīnī al-Shāfiʻī (d. 1615 or 16). Fol. 1a has an obliterated ownership statement in the name of Abū al-Suʻūd [al-Kawkabī al-Ḥusaynī?]. Partially visible oblong ownership seal on fol. 5a and 6a. Incipit: و الصلوة على محمد وآله واخوانه الكاملين ... واحمدها في مجامع الصدق واجمع مناهج المحقق ... اما بعد فان كتاب فصوص الحكم فى خصوص الكلم Explicit: فعساه يكون من اهل النجاه والشداد والله ولى التوفيق والارشاد والاسعاد واهب الاستعداد ابد الاباد والحمد لله الاول الاخر الظاهر والباطن ... والحمد لله رب العالمين
author: Jandī, Muʾayyid al-Dīn.
abstract: Commentary on Ibn al-ʻArabī's Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam.
extent: 320 leaves : paper ; 235 x 130 (182 x 83) mm. bound to 235 x 130 mm.
title: Sharḥ Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam
provenance: Originally acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda ; 1942.
contributor: Būrīnī, al-Ḥasan ibn Muḥammad, 1555 or 6-1615 or 16.
creator: جندي، مؤيد الدين.
subject: Ibn al-ʻArabī, 1165-1240—Fuṣūṣ al-ḥikam
binding note: Brown leather with gold tooled border made with guilloche and fillets. Central mandorlas with pendants, blind tooled and painted in gold and red, on upper and lower covers. Remains of fore-edge flap lining in light brown leather. Brown leather doublures with gold fillet border and gold mandorlas in the centre.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
